metadata.title: CVE-2015-2733 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Use-after-free vulnerability in the CanonicalizeXPCOMParticipant functionin Mozilla Firefox before 39.0 and Firefox ESR 31.x before 31.8 and 38.xbefore 38.1 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via vectorsinvolving attachment of an XMLHttpRequest object to a dedicated worker.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-2733` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 39.0+build5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 39.0+build5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 39.0+build5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 39.0+build5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '39.0+build5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
